subject: Re: [junit] Fast and slow tests
msgSnippet: ...  ... I wouldn t classify this test as fast, because it probably takes longer than 0.1 s to execute. I completely agree that without some kind of
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> Integration and unit tests are actually not mutually exclusive with fast and
> slow tests. Here is an example:

<snip />
> @Test(groups = {"fast", "integration"})
> public void tableShouldExist() {
> // verify that a table exists
> }

I wouldn't classify this test as fast, because it probably takes longer
than 0.1 s to execute.

I completely agree that without some kind of annotation, we can't have
tests belonging to multiple categories. I've just never wanted that
feature, that's all.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
